values:
Well, here comes my billionth excuse to why I haven't updated for the last god knows how long. It's actually a recycled one, but anyway.

I lost my game data for the second time. This time, not so stupidly. I couldn't have helped it if I had wanted to, as I lost absolutely everything on this computer that wasn't backed up. Anyway, as I had already started my stories again I felt really frustrated and didn't want to start over again. So I ran way.

So Pleasantview was reborn and I played for a while, and then I realized that without each of my characters being part of a story the game wasn't as fun for me. So I figured I had to come back. And on a crazy whim which ended up pulling through, I put together a website so that I could keep my characters and everything more tidy for myself, and also because it is fun making websites.

So that all of you reading this can roll their eyes, I'm going to tell you that yes my stories are going to have to start all over again, however, it will be the last time, as I will be backing up my files extra precautiously from now on.

So, the website should be up within a week. It's pretty much all together, except I need to add a few more character profiles and I want to (attempt to) perfect the first chapter of my Pleasantview story so that it's there for you to read when the site opens.

My apologies again.

Here is the website (http://simplified.immortal-bliss.net).

Here is my new e-mail (madeleine@simplified.immortal-bliss.net)

EDIT: If you would like me to link your Sim stories or Sims website, or basically anything Sims related, then either drop me an e-mail at the e-mail above or comment here.

During the installation of Nightlife I lost all my families. I was not so careless to not create a back-up of my files, however, I was careless enough to do god knows what, and lose my families in both sets of files. Now as hard as I tried, I just couldn't get every Sim to look just like they did before, maybe because I'm just not so skilled in the 'creating Sims' area. But the change which has most frustrated me is Aidan Powers, Jonah and Marisa's son, who turned out quite a bit more handsome, but failed to inherit his father's characteristic lips.

To the left, was before, and to the right, he is pictured now. However, due to the fact that he now looks rather cute in a boyish way, I have not tried to fix him using Body Shop, but will keep him like this, and will fix his younger brother, Nicholas. Images in my stories will now be size 600 x 450, rather than 280 x 210, which mostly saved my bandwidth, however, I have decided I'd like to increase the sizes of my images. My next update will take place tomorrow or even tonight. Each chapter will now be split into part to make my job easier in preparing them, and your job in reading them easier, as my updates are going to become longer. Can someone explain to me the American education system... or what ever it is... I'm just not sure. What I don't understand is the whole Freshman, Sophomore thing. My American friend told me that Freshman is equivalent to Grade 9, Sophomore to Grade 10, Junior to Grade 11 and Senior to Grade 12, however, then what's with the whole university thing? I honestly don't understand.

I've had a huge problem lately, and that's time. Maybe you've noticed, seeing my updates have huge spaces of time between one another. But the fact is I just don't have time for much recreational stuff anymore, and that isn't exaggerated at all. This is my final year of a 5-year curriculum course and it's my final year of IGCSE, which is really tough, and I'm just not getting many breaks to work on other things, such as this, which I love. However, I will have time to update. But not at the moment. This year I have to complete a project which we have had about four or five months to do. It's due at the end of November, and once its out of the way, I'll have a lot more time to put my effort into the things I like doing, such as my sims stories. Thanks guys. <3
Yes, soon. Very soon. Today or tomorrow. And new layout :) Because the image uses so much bandwidth, it's causing problems. If it doesn't load, I'll fix it tomorrow. But now I need to sleep.

Regretfully, I have to say that it is close to 100% that I will not be able to update until halfway through July or til the beginning of August. It's all a result of some stupidness on my behalf, and I am really disappointed that I won't be able to update until this time.

In Sydney, where I am right now, visiting relatives and friends, I stay with my grandparents, who have dial-up. This meant I couldn't spend much time on the internet. I have been playing with 'The Powers Family' (Marisa Bendett: The Road to Nowhere PART ONE) however I use a Fujitsu Stylistic ST5000, and it does not have a keyboard attached to it. Having been told that I was not allowed to pack my keyboard in my suitcase (as apparently it would break, though I do not believe it would have), I have found that my grandfather only has PS2 keyboards, and no USB keyboards. So I don't have a keyboard. This means I can't create Sims, name babies, or create dorms, and I am cut out from all keyboard shortcuts.

To top things off, I arrive in Melbourne to see my uncle, with hopes high, as they are very modern, to find that they use a wireless keyboard. Then it occurs to me that I can copy my game files onto his computer, (as he is an avid Sims fan, and owns the Sims 2). To my dismay I find that my computer has run out of battery, in which case I can't copy the files, and I have forgotten my power cable in Sydney.

So, nothing from me, guys. I'm very sorry.

But I can promise you that once I am back, I will have dozens of lovely stories ready for you.

Every dream I've had in life has never come true. Until I was about 12, I always wanted to meet my mother; I couldn't even remember who she was. I kept convincing myself that she'd come back for me and Dad someday. By my twelfth birthday I realized she wasn't coming back.

I grew up in the rough part of Pleasantview*, which hardly had the right to be described as pleasant. It's where I met Diego, and we became best friends. I'd look at people like the Goths, Diego's cousins, and I'd wonder why all their dreams came true, yet none of mine did.

That's when I decided that those people don't have dreams.

*The rough part of Pleasantview is the east side, which is basically from Nina and Don's houses east, so includes the Brokes.

But I have dreams. I wanted to spend the rest of my life with Diego, though maybe I was too young to be serious about it. He understood me, and I understood him. But he found Marsha, one of those girls from the other side of Pleasantview, who didn't have dreams, because she didn't need them.

In Academie Le Tour, I realized that to Marsha, I wasn't welcome. I was a threat to her and Diego. And so I found someone I was sure would have me. I found Jonah.

I don't know if Jonah had dreams. Maybe he had some, but I never asked. But he told me I was beautiful, something Diego had never told me I was before, and though I didn't love Jonah, I did everything he wanted.

Jonah was my first boyfriend. I knew he'd had heaps of girlfriends before. The girls in my drama class told me not to trust him. But he told me I was beautiful, so I did.

When Jonah wanted to take it to the next step, I did what he said, though I was sure I wasn't ready. But he told me I was beautiful, so I did what he wanted.

The next morning Jonah did something that I don't think I will ever understand. I had always dreamt of someone, well, Diego, proposing to me at some posh, expensive restaurant. I'd never even considered any possibility of someone proposing to me the morning after I'd lost my virginity, and three weeks after we'd met.

I wasn't ready to say yes. I wasn't ready to make such a commitment, especially to someone I was sure I didn't love. But he told me I was beautiful, so I said yes.

Every morning from then on I felt sick. I wanted to run to Jonah and cry, and tell him I didn't want to marry him. But I didn't. I would throw up every morning with misery, and spoke to barely no one. My whole drama class seemed to know about what had happened, and I constantly heard them giggling in class. Somehow I knew it was about me.

I began to eat more, because it made me feel better, and I began to put on weight. But I didn't care, because even though I had ignored Jonah's calls for the past week, I knew he'd still call me beautiful.

When I couldn't ignore Jonah any longer, I saw him again, and he asked me what was happening to me. He said I wasn't as thin as I used to be, and then I half understood why Kanta had said he was only going out with me because I looked good. And now I didn't. I promised I'd lose the weight, because I knew then that he'd call me beautiful.

Three months later I couldn't ignore the signs. I realized it wasn't the food I had started eating more of, but that I was pregnant. I didn't tell Jonah. I just didn't see him.

I called up the college reception and told them I was dropping out my course. It was my dream to be a famous actress. I held my tears as I insisted that I must drop out, ignoring the dean as she told me I was throwing away a promised career in acting.

When I hung up the phone, I cried. I called a taxi, and waited, planning not to wake anyone up, so that I could leave without question.

But it turned out that Diego was awake, and barely seconds after the taxi screeched against the road outside, I heard his footsteps coming down the stairs.

For the first time in my life, I saw Diego angry. I didn't look at him, but just left. He shouted after me, telling me to come back. And then just as I was about to shut the door, he shouted that he knew I was pregnant. I slammed the door shut, and while I was driven back to Pleasantview, I cried.

My father, Professor Damion Bendett, couldn't handle the fact that I was pregnant. I had always been his little girl, and the fact that I was only in my sophomore year distressed him.

When I told him who the father was, he began muttering a thousand curses under his breath. It didn't help when I told him we were engaged, but I knew that from then on Jonah wasn't going to get very good grades in his classes.

I told Jonah I was pregnant a week after moving out of Academie Le Tour. Surprisingly, he just laughed through the phone. My throat welled up and I had to force myself not to cry. And then he said, "Thank god for that, I thought you were just getting fat."

I wondered if he thought it was a joke, or if he thought it wasn't his baby and didn't even care. I couldn't sleep for the following nights.

A week after my birthday, I gave birth to a baby home. Though he had my large blue eyes, he had Jonah's face and hair, and I wondered if Jonah would even want anything to do with his son. I named him Aidan. Aidan Powers.

I called Jonah and told him that his son had just been born. He didn't say anything for a few moments, but I could hear him breathing. And then he told me congratulations, and that as soon as he had graduated, he'd come and live with us both.

But my last dream was to have children. And even if I never had another, I had a son now, and even if he wasn't Diego's son, he was my son, and I was happy.

A week before Jonah graduated, Aidan turned one. I didn't have a job, so I couldn't afford to hold him a party. I couldn't even afford to order one of those personally made birthday cakes. It would be a waste of money anyway, because I doubted that Aidan would even remember.

And so we waited. We waited for Jonah to come back, so that we could try and live as a family. I didn't have Diego, but I had a family that I was responsible for, and even though Jonah would never be Diego to me, I had Aidan, and Aidan needed me and Jonah, because no one knows better than me what it's like to have only one parent.

Aidan will have dreams. And his dreams will come true.

Note: Sorry for my lack of updates over the past week but I was in Cambodia :) I'm now back and I will update as regularly as possible. I leave for Australia tomorrow night. Hopefully this won't prevent me from updating. I'll find a way to do so, but I'll have dial-up at my grandparents. So I won't be updating as regularly as I would like to.

The point in this post is to give you an introduction into what's happening in my neighbourhood, with all familiar characters. I have already progressed far into my game, so to understand what's happening/happened to the familiar Maxis-created characters you all know, and introducing their descendents, I have made this post, which isn't an official start to my stories. So under the cuts...

   

The Caliente Family

Nina, having moved to Pleasantview with quite a negative attitude, and with little eagerness, found herself proved quite wrong about Pleasantview being a town for rich snobs where she wouldn't find any fun. With five simultaneous lovers, Nina was having the time of her life. That was, until she found out she was pregnant.

Most women are delighted when they find out that they're bearing the child of their love interest, but you see, most women only have one, and Nina had several, and not one of whom she was largely actually in love with.

Nina and Dina, having moved to Pleasantview after their once rich parents declared bankruptcy, did not have much money, and Nina had no choice but to keep the baby. Soon, Nina couldn't hide the fact that her stomach was growing, and broke the news to all five of her 'boyfriends. Herb, being a married man who was just about to reach his 40th anniversary, became extremely stressed, and told her not to breathe word of her being pregnant with his baby. Phineaus, not even out of college, turned pale and began exasperating over his lost dreams for becoming a mad scientist. Gordon, a robber who Nina had somehow forgiven for stealing her TV, left as soon as possible, obviously not willing to pay any child support, and Daniel became extremely aggressive towards his football players. Don Lothario, having no care whatsoever, and quite aware of the fact that Nina was ignorant of monogamy, treated her in the same way as before.

Dina, wanting nothing at all to do with Nina's child, was delighted when Mortimer Goth popped the question. She had worked quite cunningly at organizing the murder of Bella Goth, her former sister-in-law, and would have been extremely disappointed if her work had been for nothing.

Dina moved in right away, and found utmost delight at having no wedding budget limits. She planned to have the biggest wedding Pleasantview had seen in all of its 30 years of history.

Nina gave birth to a baby boy, whom she named Diego. Though Nina had never been keen on having children, she grew quite fond of Diego, and it wasn't difficult for her to figure out who his father was, as they shared similar attributes. Nina had given birth to Don's son, though she was quite sure he would not care, and would have no interest for his growing son.

  

But Nina had never been one to learn from her mistakes, and bringing up Diego on every spare penny she could find was no uplifting job. Nina was absolutely horrified when she found she was once again pregnant, gambling possibilities of who might be the father.

Though it was a delight for Madeleine, Nina was definitely not thrilled at giving birth to twin girls, who she named Fia and Mirari, both obviously the daughters of Don Lothario.

Diego grew up into a teenager, and fell in love with Marsha Bruenig, who seemed to be good at every possible thing, and did not have any friendly feelings for her boyfriend's mother. She also found the twins incredibly annoying, in particular, Fia.

Fia and Mirari grew up very close. Mirari was quieter than Fia. She was more reserved and shy, and took pleasure in relaxing activities, such as reading and stargazing. Fia, however, took an instant liking to the stereo player upstairs, and spent most of her free time dancing, or watching television.

   

The Goth Family

Dina did have the most extravagant wedding Pleasantview had seen, inviting almost every inhabitant of Pleasantview. She spent most of the reception party teasing Nina, maybe about the fact that she had just married the richest man in Pleasantview, and that Nina had been left in their apartment with three children, as a single mother.

Dina had also scored a job in Mortimer's company, SmartMilk, which had been invented by Mortimer's father. She brought home quite a lot of cash, though the family didn't really need it, but she was quite unsatisfied with sitting at home like a lonely housewife, and not participating in making the income.

Soon after the new married couple had settled in, Dina gave birth to a daughter, Lorne. Dina had always wanted a daughter, and grew very fond of Lorne, however, after Alexander taking a rebellious streak and refusing to take over the Goth household, Mortimer was in desperate want for a son.

He did, however, teach his daughter everything with most enthusiasm, such as reading, and playing chess, and understanding how the stock exchange worked on SimCity News. She attended school, and brought home fantastic grades, and played the piano with most talent.

Halfway through primary school, Lorne was greeted with the news of her new baby brother, Archibald Goth.

And to cut a long story short, Dina gave birth to a third son, Constantine. Archibald had inherited Dina's features in every possible way, including the thin, raised eyebrows, which look extraordinarily feminine, whereas Constantine looked more like his father. Lorne also looked like her father, but had an unusually large nose.

The family grew up with every luxury that they deemed expensive enough.

Lorne, having become a teenager, aspired popularity. She would bring a new friend home every day after school, and was described as extremely outgoing and friendly by her teachers in school reports. She hosted the school's most memorable parties, and she collected friends like her father did stamps.

But, Mortimer and Dina only wanting the best for Lorne, arranged her engagement, with a boy from a most respectable family, Chandler Platz, whose father was a very wealthy merchant from Veronaville. Ideally, Lorne found Chandler a very amiable boy, and fell head over heels in love with him, though she admitted his bossiness and quite temper.

  

The Goth Family

Alexander Goth, being the only son in the Goth family, had been promised quite a hefty pile of money for when he graduated from college. However, Alexander had his values and priorities set in order. For one, he was most objective to his father having gotten remarried to a woman only five years older than he was, so soon after the mysterious disappearance of his mother, and had therefore turned down the Goth fortune, deciding to make his life on his own.

He attended college, where he felt rather out of place, as he had in all previous schools. However, he was able to meet Marla Biggs, who was very sensitive about her weight, but who really turned out to be a nice girl.

Unfortunately, Alexander, let's say, grew out of love with Marla, and after graduation, met Marylena, who he grew much in love with. It was after two years of dating, when Alexander knew that he wanted to spend the rest of his life with her, that he proposed to her, and with the $50 000 Mortimer had refused not to give his son, they were able to build up a nice, comfortable home. They were soon married and were very happy.

Alexander, having always been incredibly smart, no doubts thanks to the SmartMilk his grandfather had invented, was able to get a high paying job in the science career, and brought home promotions as often as he brought home cash.

Marylena and Alexander had been married three years before they decided to take the next step forwards in their lives. Marylena gave birth to Mortimer's first grandson soon later. They named him Auberon, and Marylena delightedly dressed him in pink pajamas, to reflect his loving personality.

Really, Auberon had quite a fastidious personality.

 

The de la Fontaine Family

Augustine and Georgina de la Fontaine came from France with their baby daughter Amie, because Georgina had always dreamed of owning a summer mansion in Pleasantview. Augustine, being a very professional businessman, had raised up quite a nice fortune for the de la Fontaine family, who openly rivaled the Goth family as far as money went.

However being both wealthy families, Dina found it quite necessary to make sure Archibald had Amie's hand promised in marriage, as Archibald was the Goth fortune's heir, after all.

And so at the age of barely 5, Amie was engaged to Archibald Goth. She grew up to be quite a pretty girl, and was incredibly popular at school. In fact, Archibald hardly needed to know he would marry her one day to fall completely in love with her.

The Broke Family

The Broke family was, as their name says it, absolutely broke. After finding out she was pregnant with her deceased husband's baby, Brandi went into a period of depression. She had lost everything, and began to regret everything she had done in life. Such as, dropping out of school at 16, having Dustin at 17 and getting married at 18. To her, her life was a mess.

Her third son, she named Probyn. Brandi had always wanted a daughter, but it seemed she would never have one. It was her life dream to have ten children, but it seemed she never would. She could always marry another man, but she would go to sleep with guilt for even thinking about it, for she still loved her husband, though he had died several years before.

The Pleasant Family The Pleasant twins went to Academie le Tour like their money-loving mother would have it. Angela, having always been smart and popular, settled in right away, achieving high grades and making lots of friends. She remained with her first boyfriend Dustin, all throughout her college years.

Lilith, having always been the more rebellious child of the family, had quite a different experience at college. She only just scraped her final exams, and was caught cheating by her boyfriend, Dirk Dreamer, who called off the relationship straight away.

My name is Madeleine ( ), and I love playing the Sims 2. I also love reading other people's Sims' Stories, and I write about all my Sims anyway. So I thought it would be a great idea to create my own Sims Journal, as it would be greatly enjoyable for me, and I hope for everyone else too.

This is my Sims journal. I can be reached at my r-l journal at . There you will find me to be a complete HP addict, but a relatively nice and friendly person :)

I can be reached by e-mail at madeileinn@yahoo.com.au, and I am occasionally online AIM at madeilein, but, I can warn you, not often.

Basically, in this journal, I will write about my Sims, in a narrative form, most likely in third person in most circumstances. I may particular families more often, but I should give a fair selection of whichever neighbourhood I'm playing, which I also tend to switch.

Often I will play Maxis-created families. In fact, a lot of the time. I do create quite a liking to the Maxis-created Sims, but I promise to make everything as interesting as I possibly can.

I have nothing against bisexuality, homosexuality, other races, or anything. If you do have a problem with any of these, then that is not my problem, and therefore do not make it my business to listen to you complain.

My Sims

I definitely have my favourite Sims. To name a few that most of you will know of, Dina Caliente, Dirk Dreamer, and Beau Broke. I play in an assortment of neighbourhoods, and I connect them as one world, like different cities. I will sometimes mention the other neighbourhoods in my stories.

I must admit that I am incredibly picky about noses. I am only trying to loosen up a bit, but I get incredibly annoyed if my Sims' noses turn out in any way weird. A lot of my custom made females will have the same noses. I am, however, flexible with hairstyles, hair colours and eye colours.

I do not delete any Maxis-created Sims. I might kill them off in a way which makes a story, but I will not send them to the Sim Bin. Excluding the fact that I quite like a lot of the Maxis-created Sims, I am quite a perfectionist, and though it probably doesn't bother many other players of the Sims 2, and it should not bother you, I like my Sim family trees to be complete, with all ascendents dead. By killing off ascendents, it leaves their icon coloured, and even if you find this absolutely crazy, it is one of the most annoying things for me.

I do not often use any money cheats. I age-transition my less-favourite families, to save time and keep my story going. I do not use mood cheats unless I have gotten myself into an incredibly sticky situation. I do not use the cosmetic machine unless it is an incredible must. I fully admit to using relationship hacks for romance Sims. This is because building up 30 relationships just so my Sim can make out with him and then send him off is something that I can't bother myself to do.

But I play my game to have fun. And if it's fun for me, I believe that's most important.
